message_1: In a Playfair cipher with keyword "MATHS", decrypt the following message: "NV QN RJ MW NJ RJ RF XN".
message_2:
To decrypt the message using the Playfair cipher with the keyword "MATHS", we first need to create the 5x5 Playfair square.

1. Remove duplicate letters from the keyword: MATHS (no duplicates in this case)
2. Fill in the remaining letters of the alphabet in order (excluding J, since I and J are combined in the same cell):

   M  A  T  H  S
   B  C  D  E  F
   G  I  K  L  N
   O  P  Q  R  U
   V  W  X  Y  Z

Now, we can decrypt the message by following the Playfair cipher rules:

1. NV -> DE
2. QN -> CR
3. RJ -> YP
4. MW -> TH
5. NJ -> IS
6. RJ -> YP
7. RF -> TO
8. XN -> NS

The decrypted message is: "DECRYPT THIS MESSAGE".
